summary: Federal employees use secure facilities—known as "SCIFs"—to work with classified information. But some SCIFs aren't accessible for employees with disabilities—e.g., some doors are too heavy to open, or doorways are too narrow for wheelchairs. While the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (ODNI) has taken some steps to address access issues, it can do more. For example, it should improve its guidance on SCIFs...
title: Federal Real Property: Improved Data and Access Needed for Employees with Disabilities Using Secure Facilities
